metadata.title: CVE-2021-46932 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: Input:appletouch - initialize work before device registration Syzbot has reportedwarning in __flush_work(). This warning is caused by work->func == NULL,which means missing work initialization. This may happen, sinceinput_dev->close() calls cancel_work_sync(&dev->work), but dev->workinitalization happens _after_ input_register_device() call. So this patchmoves dev->work initialization before registering input device

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-lowlatency - 4.4.0-257.291
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-173-generic - 4.15.0-173.182~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-173-generic - 4.15.0-173.182~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-173-lowlatency - 4.15.0-173.182~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-kvm - 4.4.0-1135.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1172-aws - 4.4.0-1172.187
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-aws - 4.15.0-1124.133~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-azure - 4.15.0-1134.147~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-gcp - 4.15.0-1119.133~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1090-oracle - 4.15.0-1090.99~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-257.291').

linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').

linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
